Name: Requiring each police precinct to have a licensed social worker.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring each police precinct to have a licensed social worker.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety

Summary: This bill would require the New York City Police Department to have a licensed clinical social worker located at every precinct.  Such social worker would be available 24 hours a day and 7 days a week.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

      Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 14 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 14-175 to read as follows:
      � 14-175 Social workers at precincts.  The department shall have a licensed clinical social worker located at every precinct. Such social workers shall be available at the precinct twenty four hours a day and every day of the week.   
      � 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes law.  

LS 11869/Int. 1836-2017
LS 695
DA
1/5/18
